info.name: Small Settlements
info.attribution:
Room design and layout by LawDawg96. The card back image by OpenClipart-Vectors is available under the Pixabay license from https://pixabay.com/vectors/village-medieval-middle-ages-145656/. Other icons are available under CC BY 3.0 from: - Delapouite House https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/house.html Barn https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/barn.html Church https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/church.html Shop https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/shop.html Tavern https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/tavern-sign.html Flour https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/flour.html Cave https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/cave-entrance.html - Lorc Tower https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/white-tower.html - Caro Ascercion Water mill https://game-icons.net/1x1/caro-asercion/water-mill.html

Library image generated using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "small settlements oil on canvas by thomas kinkade --ar 1:1 --v 5.1"
info.description: Place colored resource blocks into designated patterns on individual 4x4 grid board. When pattern is completed, turn resource cubes into buildings with special point scoring powers. Play until all players can no longer place resources. Highest score wins.
info.helpText:
Players take seats. Press reset button in upper right and choose options. Press turn button to advance turn indicator for player that is the Master Builder. At end of game, enter scores into table on left. Sum is calculated automatically. Be sure to enter 0 or a negative number for the space with the X indicating blank squares remaining. Players can click on the eye icon beneath any player's seat to see that player's board. Click back on the eye icon beneath your own seat to view your board.

If playing with Town Hall rules, click the next button on the left side of the screen to choose the next resource. If playing solo mode, move the used resource card into the small holder on the left. Move the resource onto the board, then press the +1 button to update the available resources.

fields.text: You are about to reset the board. Select options below then press Reset to begin a new game or Cancel to close this menu.

fields.label: Play in solo mode? (Do not use either of the 2 middle seats for solo mode).

loopRoutine: // Remove the playerName from the `onlyVisibleForSeat` property of the other boards

Cavern.note: Twice per game, you may place a resource named by another player near your seat for no points and no penalties.

Shed.note: (1). May place on any empty square on the board.

Inn.note: (3) if not in row or column with another Inn.

Feast Hall.note: (2). +(1) if you have more Feast Halls than player on your right.

Orchard.note: Feeds all buildings in same row or column.

Greenhouse.note: Feeds 1 continguous group of buildings anywhere on the board.

Granary.note: Feeds all buildings in surrounding 8 squares.

Farm.note: Feeds 4 buildings anywhere on the board.

Theater.note: (1) for each other unique building type in same row and column.

Tailor.note: (1). +(1) for each other Tailor in 4 center squares of the board.

Market.note: (1) for each Market in same row or column (not both).

Cloister.note: (1) for each Cloister in a corner of the board.

Temple.note: (4) if adjacent to at least 2 fed [A].

Bank.note: (4). Place a resource on this building that is not on another Bank on your board. As Master Builder, you can no longer name that resource.

Trading Post.note: (1). You may treat Trading Post as a wildcard resource for future buildings.

Warehouse.note: -(1) for each resource on Warehouse. Each Warehouse can store 3 resources. When another player names a resource, you may place it on a Warehouse or swap it with another one on a Warehouse.

Factory.note: When built, place 1 of the 5 resources on the Factory. When another player names that resource, you may substitute a different one.

Mandras Palace.note: (2) for each unique adjacent building type.

Obelisk of the Crescent.note: You may place all future buildings on any empty space on the board.

Grove University.note: (3). Immediately place a building on an empty square on your board.

Silva Forum.note: (1). +(1) for each building in largest continguous group of same type.

Statue of the Bondmaker.note: When another player names a resource, you can place it on a square with [A]. Each [A] can hold 1 resource.

The Sky Baths.note: (2) for each building type missing on your board.

Architect's Guild.note: (1). When built, replace up to 2 buildings on board with a different type.

Archive of the Second Age.note: (1) for each unique building type other than [H] on your board.

Cathedral of Caterina.note: (2). Empty squares on board are worth 0 instead of -1.

Fort Ironweed.note: (7). Unless you are the last player, no longer take turns as Master Builder.

Opaleye's Watch.note: Immediately place 3 unique buildings on this card. Whenever a player on your left or right builds 1 of those buildings, take building from here and place on empty square on your board.

Cavern.note: Twice per game, you may place a resource named by another player on this card for no points and no penalties.

Shed.note: (1). May place on any empty square on the board.

Inn.note: (3) if not in row or column with another Inn.

Feast Hall.note: (2). +(1) if you have more Feast Halls than player on your right.

Orchard.note: Feeds all buildings in same row or column.

Greenhouse.note: Feeds 1 continguous group of buildings anywhere on the board.

Granary.note: Feeds all buildings in surrounding 8 squares.

Farm.note: Feeds 4 buildings anywhere on the board.

Theater.note: (1) for each other unique building type in same row and column.

Tailor.note: (1). +(1) for each other Tailor in 4 center squares of the board.

Market.note: (1) for each Market in same row or column (not both).

Cloister.note: (1) for each Cloister in a corner of the board.

Temple.note: (4) if adjacent to at least 2 fed [A].

Bank.note: (4). Place a resource on this building that is not on another Bank on your board. As Master Builder, you can no longer name that resource.

Trading Post.note: (1). You may treat Trading Post as a wildcard resource for future buildings.

Warehouse.note: -(1) for each resource on Warehouse. Each Warehouse can store 3 resources. When another player names a resource, you may place it on a Warehouse or swap it with another one on a Warehouse.

Factory.note: When built, place 1 of the 5 resources on the Factory. When another player names that resource, you may substitute a different one.
